In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was fully God.
undefined The Word was with God in the beginning.
undefined All things were created by him, and apart from him not one thing was created that has been created.
undefined In him was life, and the life was the light of mankind.
undefined And the light shines on in the darkness, but the dark-ness has not mastered it.
undefined A man came, sent from God, whose name was John.
undefined He came as a witness to testify about the light, so that everyone might believe through him.
undefined He himself was not the light, but he came to testify about the light.
undefined The true light, who gives light to everyone, was coming into the world.
undefined He was in the world, and the world was created by him, but the world did not recognize him.
undefined He came to what was his own, but his own people did not receive him.
undefined But to all who have re-ceived him – those who believe in his name – he has given the right to become God’s chil-dren
undefined – children not born by human par-ents or by human desire or a husband’s deci-sion, but by God.
undefined Now the Word became flesh and took up residence among us. We saw his glory – the glory of the one and only, full of grace and truth, who came from the Father.
undefined John testified about him and shouted out, “This one was the one about whom I said, ‘He who comes after me is greater than I am, because he existed before me.’”
undefined For we have all re-ceived from his fullness one gracious gift after another.
undefined For the law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came about through Jesus Christ.
undefined No one has ever seen God. The only one, himself God, who is in closest fellowship with the Father, has made God known.The Testimony of John the Baptist
undefined Now this was John’s testimony when the Jewish leaders sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
undefined He confessed – he did not deny but con-fessed – “I am not the Christ!”
undefined So they asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Eli-jah?” He said, “I am not!” “Are you the Prophet?” He answered, “No!”
undefined Then they said to him, “Who are you? Tell us so that we can give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
undefined John said, “I am the voice of one shouting in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way for the Lord,’ as Isaiah the prophet said.”
undefined (Now they had been sent from the Phari-sees.)
undefined So they asked John, “Why then are you baptizing if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
undefined John answered them, “I baptize with water. Among you stands one whom you do not recognize,
undefined who is coming after me. I am not worthy to untie the strap of his san-dal!”
undefined These things happened in Bethany across the Jordan River where John was bap-tizing.
undefined On the next day John saw Jesus com-ing toward him and said, “Look, the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
undefined This is the one about whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who is greater than I am, because he existed before me.’
undefined I did not recognize him, but I came baptizing with water so that he could be revealed to Israel.”
undefined Then John testified, “I saw the Spirit descending like a dove from heaven, and it remained on him.

undefined And I did not recognize him, but the one who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘The one on whom you see the Spirit descending and remaining – this is the one who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
undefined I have both seen and testified that this man is the Chosen One of God.”
undefined Again the next day John was standing there with two of his disciples.
undefined Gazing at Jesus as he walked by, he said, “Look, the Lamb of God!”
undefined When John’s two disci-ples heard him say this, they followed Jesus.
undefined Jesus turned around and saw them fol-lowing and said to them, “What do you want?” So they said to him, “Rabbi” (which is translated Teacher), “where are you staying?”
undefined Jesus answered, “Come and you will see.” So they came and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day. Now it was about four o’clock in the afternoon.Andrew’s Declaration
undefined Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two disciples who heard what John said and followed Jesus.
undefined He first found his own brother Simon and told him, “We have found the Messiah!” (which is trans-lated Christ).
undefined Andrew brought Simon to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You are Simon, the son of John. You will be called Cephas” (which is translated Peter).The Calling of More Disciples
undefined On the next day Jesus wanted to set out for Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow me.”
undefined (Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the town of Andrew and Peter.)
undefined Philip found Nathanael and told him, “We have found the one Moses wrote about in the law, and the prophets also wrote about – Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
undefined Nathanael replied, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip replied, “Come and see.”
undefined Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him and exclaimed, “Look, a true Israelite in whom there is no deceit!”
undefined Nathanael asked him, “How do you know me?” Jesus replied, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
undefined Na-thanael answered him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the king of Israel!”
undefined Jesus said to him, “Because I told you that I saw you under the fig tree, do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”
undefined He continued, “I tell all of you the solemn truth – you will see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”Turning Water into Wine
Now on the third day there was a wedding at Cana in Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there,
undefined and Jesus and his disciples were also invited to the wedding.
undefined When the wine ran out, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They have no wine left.”
undefined Jesus replied, “Woman, why are you saying this to me? My time has not yet come.”
undefined His mother told the servants, “Whatever he tells you, do it.”
undefined Now there were six stone water jars there for Jewish ceremonial washing, each holding twenty or thirty gallons.
undefined Jesus told the servants, “Fill the water jars with water.” So they filled them up to the very top.
undefined Then he told them, “Now draw some out and take it to the head steward,” and they did.
undefined When the head steward tasted the water that had been turned to wine, not knowing where it came from (though the servants who had drawn the water knew), he called the bride-groom
undefined and said to him, “Everyone serves the good wine first, and then the cheaper wine when the guests are drunk. You have kept the good wine until now!”
undefined Jesus did this as the first of his miraculous signs, in Cana of Galilee. In this way he revealed his glory, and his disciples believed in him.Cleansing the Temple
undefined After this he went down to Caperna-um with his mother and brothers and his disci-ples, and they stayed there a few days.
undefined Now the Jewish feast of Passover was near, so Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
undefined He found in the temple courts those who were selling oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers sitting at tables.
undefined So he made a whip of cords and drove them all out of the temple courts, with the sheep and the oxen. He scattered the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.
undefined To those who sold the doves he said, “Take these things away from here! Do not make my Fa-ther’s house a marketplace!”
undefined His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for your house will devour me.”
undefined So then the Jewish leaders responded, “What sign can you show us, since you are doing these things?”
undefined Jesus replied, “De-stroy this temple and in three days I will raise it up again.”
undefined Then the Jewish leaders said to him, “This temple has been under construc-tion for forty-six years, and are you going to raise it up in three days?”
undefined But Jesus was speaking about the temple of his body.
undefined So after he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this, and they believed the scripture and the saying that Jesus had spoken.Jesus at the Passover Feast
undefined Now while Jesus was in Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover, many people be-lieved in his name because they saw the mirac-ulous signs he was doing.
undefined But Jesus would not entrust himself to them, because he knew all people.
undefined He did not need anyone to testify about man, for he knew what was in man.Conversation with Nicodemus
Now a certain man, a Pharisee named Nicodemus, who was a member of the Jewish ruling council,
undefined came to Jesus at night and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher who has come from God. For no one could perform the miraculous signs that you do unless God is with him.”
undefined Jesus replied, “I tell you the solemn truth, unless a person is born from above, he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
undefined Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is old? He cannot enter his mother’s womb and be born a second time, can he?”
undefined Jesus answered, “I tell you the solemn truth, unless a person is born of water and spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.

undefined Do not be amazed that I said to you, ‘You must all be born from above.’

undefined Nicodemus replied, “How can these things be?”
undefined Jesus answered, “Are you the teacher of Israel and yet you don’t understand these things?

undefined If I have told you people about earthly things and you don’t believe, how will you believe if I tell you about heavenly things?
undefined No one has as-cended into heaven except the one who de-scended from heaven – the Son of Man.
undefined Just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wil-derness, so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
undefined so that everyone who believes in him may have eternal life.”
undefined For this is the way God loved the world: He gave his one and only Son, so that everyone who believes in him will not perish but have eternal life.
undefined For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world should be saved through him.
undefined The one who believes in him is not condemned. The one who does not be-lieve has been condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of the one and only Son of God.
undefined Now this is the basis for judging: that the light has come into the world and people loved the darkness rather than the light, because their deeds were evil.
undefined For everyone who does evil deeds hates the light and does not come to the light, so that their deeds will not be exposed.
undefined But the one who practices the truth comes to the light, so that it may be plainly evident that his deeds have been done in God.Further Testimony About Jesus by John the Baptist
undefined After this, Jesus and his disciples came into Judean territory, and there he spent time with them and was baptizing.
undefined John was also baptizing at Aenon near Salim, be-cause water was plentiful there, and people were coming to him and being baptized.
undefined (For John had not yet been thrown into pris-on.)
undefined Now a dispute came about between some of John’s disciples and a certain Jew concerning ceremonial washing.

undefined He must become more im-portant while I become less important.”
undefined The one who comes from above is su-perior to all. The one who is from the earth belongs to the earth and speaks about earthly things. The one who comes from heaven is superior to all.
undefined He testifies about what he has seen and heard, but no one accepts his testimony.
undefined The one who has accepted his testimony has confirmed clearly that God is truthful.
undefined For the one whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for he does not give the Spirit sparingly.
undefined The Father loves the Son and has placed all things under his author-ity.
undefined The one who believes in the Son has eternal life. The one who rejects the Son will not see life, but God’s wrath remains on him.Departure From Judea

undefined (although Jesus himself was not baptizing, but his disci-ples were),
undefined he left Judea and set out once more for Galilee.Conversation With a Samaritan Woman
undefined But he had to pass through Samaria.
undefined Now he came to a Samaritan town called Sychar, near the plot of land that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.
undefined Jacob’s well was there, so Jesus, since he was tired from the journey, sat right down beside the well. It was about noon.
undefined A Samaritan woman came to draw wa-ter. Jesus said to her, “Give me some water to drink.”
undefined (For his disciples had gone off into the town to buy supplies.)

undefined Jesus answered her, “If you had known the gift of God and who it is who said to you, ‘Give me some water to drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”

undefined Jesus replied, “Everyone who drinks some of this water will be thirsty again.

undefined He said to her, “Go call your husband and come back here.”
undefined The woman replied, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “Right you are when you said, ‘I have no husband,’

undefined Then the woman left her water jar, went off into the town and said to the people,

undefined So they left the town and began coming to him.Workers for the Harvest
undefined Meanwhile the disciples were urging him, “Rabbi, eat something.”
undefined But he said to them, “I have food to eat that you know nothing about.”

undefined The one who reaps receives pay and gathers fruit for eternal life, so that the one who sows and the one who reaps can re-joice together.

undefined Now there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate a pool called Bethzatha in Aramaic, which has five covered walkways.
undefined A great number of sick, blind, lame, and paralyzed people were lying in these walkways.

undefined Now because Jesus was doing these things on the Sabbath, the Jewish leaders be-gan persecuting him.
undefined So he told them, “My Father is working until now, and I too am working.”

undefined but you are not willing to come to me so that you may have life.

undefined A large crowd was following him because they were observing the miracu-lous signs he was performing on the sick.
undefined So Jesus went on up the mountainside and sat down there with his disciples.
undefined (Now the Jewish feast of the Passover was near.)
undefined Then Jesus, when he looked up and saw that a large crowd was coming to him, said to Philip, “Where can we buy bread so that these people may eat?”
undefined (Now Jesus said this to test him, for he knew what he was going to do.)
undefined Philip replied, “Two hundred silver coins worth of bread would not be enough for them, for each one to get a little.”
undefined One of Jesus’ disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to him,
undefined “Here is a boy who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what good are these for so many people?”
undefined Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” (Now there was a lot of grass in that place.) So the men sat down, about five thou-sand in number.

undefined So they gathered them up and filled twelve baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves left over by the people who had eaten.

undefined Now when evening came, his disciples went down to the lake,
undefined got into a boat, and started to cross the lake to Capernaum. (It had already become dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.)
undefined By now a strong wind was blowing and the sea was getting rough.
undefined Then, when they had rowed about three or four miles, they caught sight of Jesus walk-ing on the lake, approaching the boat, and they were frightened.
undefined But he said to them, “It is I. Do not be afraid.”
undefined Then they wanted to take him into the boat, and immediately the boat came to the land where they had been heading.

undefined But some boats from Tiberias came to shore near the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
undefined So when the crowd realized that neither Jesus nor his disci-ples were there, they got into the boats and came to Capernaum looking for Jesus.Jesus’ Discourse About the Bread of Life

undefined So then they said to him, “What must we do to accomplish the deeds God requires?”

undefined So they said to him, “Then what miracu-lous sign will you perform, so that we may see it and believe you? What will you do?

undefined So they said to him, “Sir, give us this bread all the time!”
undefined Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. The one who comes to me will never go hungry, and the one who believes in me will never be thirsty.

undefined For this is the will of my Father – for everyone who looks on the Son and believes in him to have eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.”

undefined and they said, “Isn’t this Jesus the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How can he now say, ‘I have come down from heaven’?”
undefined Jesus replied, “Do not complain about me to one another.
undefined No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up at the last day.
undefined It is written in the prophets, ‘And they will all be taught by God.’ Everyone who hears and learns from the Father comes to me.
undefined (Not that anyone has seen the Father except the one who is from God – he has seen the Father.)
undefined I tell you the solemn truth, the one who believes has eternal life.
undefined I am the bread of life.
undefined Your ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.
undefined This is the bread that has come down from heaven, so that a person may eat from it and not die.
undefined I am the living bread that came down from heaven. If anyone eats from this bread he will live forever. The bread that I will give for the life of the world is my flesh.”
undefined Then the Jews who were hostile to Je-sus began to argue with one another, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
undefined Jesus said to them, “I tell you the solemn truth, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in yourselves.
undefined The one who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.
undefined For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
undefined The one who eats my flesh and drinks my blood resides in me, and I in him.
undefined Just as the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father, so the one who consumes me will live because of me.
undefined This is the bread that came down from heaven; it is not like the bread your an-cestors ate, but then later died. The one who eats this bread will live forever.”Many Followers Depart
undefined Jesus said these things while he was teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.
undefined Then many of his disciples, when they heard these things, said, “This is a difficult saying! Who can understand it?”
undefined When Jesus was aware that his disciples were complaining about this, he said to them, “Does this cause you to be offended?
undefined Then what if you see the Son of Man ascending where he was be-fore?

undefined (Now it was the day of preparation for the Passover, about noon.) Pilate said to the Jewish leaders, “Look, here is your king!”
undefined Then they shouted out, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate asked, “Shall I crucify your king?” The high priests replied, “We have no king except Cae-sar!”
undefined Then Pilate handed him over to them to be crucified.The Crucifixion	So they took Jesus,
undefined and carrying his own cross he went out to the place called “The Place of the Skull” (called in Aramaic Golgo-tha).
undefined There they crucified him along with two others, one on each side, with Jesus in the middle.
undefined Pilate also had a notice written and fastened to the cross, which read: “Jesus the Nazarene, the king of the Jews.”
undefined Thus many of the Jewish residents of Jerusa-lem read this notice, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and the notice was written in Aramaic, Latin, and Greek.
undefined Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The king of the Jews,’ but rather, ‘This man said, I am king of the Jews.’”
undefined Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”

undefined Now when the soldiers crucified Je-sus, they took his clothes and made four shares, one for each soldier, and the tunic re-mained. (Now the tunic was seamless, woven from top to bottom as a single piece.)

undefined So the soldiers said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but throw dice to see who will get it.” This took place to fulfill the scripture that says, “They divided my garments among them, and for my clothing they threw dice.” So the sol-diers did these things.
undefined Now standing beside Jesus’ cross were his mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
undefined So when Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother, “Woman, look, here is your son!”
undefined He then said to his disciple, “Look, here is your mother!” From that very time the disci-ple took her into his own home.Jesus’ Death
undefined After this Jesus, realizing that by this time everything was completed, said (in order to fulfill the scripture), “I am thirsty!”
undefined A jar full of sour wine was there, so they put a sponge soaked in sour wine on a branch of hyssop and lifted it to his mouth.
undefined When he had received the sour wine, Jesus said, “It is completed!” Then he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.

undefined Then, because it was the day of preparation, so that the bodies should not stay on the crosses on the Sabbath (for that Sab-bath was an especially important one), the Jewish leaders asked Pilate to have the vic-tims’ legs broken and the bodies taken down.
undefined So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the two men who had been crucified with Jesus, first the one and then the other.
undefined But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
undefined But one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and blood and water flowed out immediately.
undefined And the person who saw it has testified (and his testimony is true, and he knows that he is telling the truth), so that you also may believe.
undefined For these things hap-pened so that the scripture would be fulfilled, “Not a bone of his will be broken.”
undefined And again another scripture says, “They will look on the one whom they have pierced.”Jesus’ Burial

undefined After this, Joseph of Arimathea, a disciple of Jesus (but secretly, because he feared the Jewish leaders), asked Pilate if he could remove the body of Jesus. Pilate gave him permission, so he went and took the body away.
undefined Nicodemus, the man who had previously come to Jesus at night, accompa-nied Joseph, carrying a mixture of myrrh and aloes weighing about seventy-five pounds.
undefined Then they took Jesus’ body and wrapped it, with the aromatic spices, in strips of linen cloth according to Jewish burial customs.
undefined Now at the place where Jesus was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden was a new tomb where no one had yet been buried.
undefined And so, because it was the Jewish day of preparation and the tomb was nearby, they placed Jesus’ body there.The Resurrection
Now very early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene came to the tomb and saw that the stone had been moved away from the entrance.
undefined So she went running to Simon Peter and the other disciple whom Jesus loved and told them, “They have taken the Lord from the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put him!”
undefined Then Peter and the other disciple set out to go to the tomb.
undefined The two were running together, but the other disciple ran faster than Peter and reached the tomb first.
undefined He bent down and saw the strips of linen cloth lying there, but he did not go in.
undefined Then Simon Peter, who had been following him, arrived and went right into the tomb. He saw the strips of linen cloth lying there,
undefined and the face cloth, which had been around Jesus’ head, not lying with the strips of linen cloth but rolled up in a place by itself.
undefined Then the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, came in, and he saw and believed.
undefined (For they did not yet understand the scripture that Jesus must rise from the dead.)Jesus’ Appearance to Mary Magdalene
undefined So the disciples went back to their homes.
undefined But Mary stood outside the tomb weeping. As she wept, she bent down and looked into the tomb.
undefined And she saw two angels in white sitting where Jesus’ body had been lying, one at the head and one at the feet.
undefined They said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” Mary replied, “They have taken my Lord away, and I do not know where they have put him!”
undefined When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know that it was Jesus.

undefined Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?” Be-cause she thought he was the gardener, she said to him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will take him.”
undefined Jesus said to her, “Mary.” She turned and said to him in Aramaic, “Rab-boni” (which means Teacher).
undefined Jesus re-plied, “Do not touch me, for I have not yet ascended to my Father. Go to my brothers and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”
undefined Mary Magdalene came and informed the dis-ciples, “I have seen the Lord!” And she told them what Jesus had said to her.Jesus’ Appearance to the Disciples

undefined On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, the disciples had gathered together and locked the doors of the place because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders. Jesus came and stood among them and said to them, “Peace be with you.”
undefined When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.
undefined So Jesus said to them again, “Peace be with you. Just as the Father has sent me, I also send you.”
undefined And after he said this, he breathed on them and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
undefined If you forgive anyone’s sins, they are forgiven; if you retain anyone’s sins, they are retained.”The Response of Thomas
undefined Now Thomas (called Didymus), one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.

undefined The other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he replied, “Unless I see the wounds from the nails in his hands, and put my finger into the wounds from the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will never believe it!”
undefined Eight days later the disciples were again together in the house, and Thomas was with them. Although the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace be with you!”
undefined Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and examine my hands. Extend your hand and put it into my side. Do not continue in your unbelief, but believe.”
undefined Thomas replied to him, “My Lord and my God!”
undefined Jesus said to him, “Have you believed because you have seen me? Blessed are the people who have not seen and yet have believed.”
undefined Now Jesus performed many other miraculous signs in the presence of the disci-ples, which are not recorded in this book.
undefined But these are recorded so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.Jesus’ Appearance to the Disciples in Galilee
After this Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples by the Sea of Tiberias. Now this is how he did so.
undefined Simon Peter, Thom-as (called Didymus), Nathanael (who was from Cana in Galilee), the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples of his were together.
undefined Simon Peter told them, “I am going fish-ing.” “We will go with you,” they replied. They went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.
undefined When it was already very early morn-ing, Jesus stood on the beach, but the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
undefined So Jesus said to them, “Children, you don’t have any fish, do you?” They replied, “No.”
undefined He told them, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they threw the net, and were not able to pull it in because of the large number of fish.

undefined Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” So Simon Peter, when he heard that it was the Lord, tucked in his outer garment (for he had nothing on un-derneath it), and plunged into the sea.
undefined Meanwhile the other disciples came with the boat, dragging the net full of fish, for they were not far from land, only about a hundred yards.
undefined When they got out on the beach, they saw a charcoal fire ready with a fish placed on it, and bread.
undefined Jesus said, “Bring some of the fish you have just now caught.”
undefined So Simon Peter went aboard and pulled the net to shore. It was full of large fish, one hundred fifty-three, but although there were so many, the net was not torn.
undefined “Come, have break-fast,” Jesus said. But none of the disciples dared to ask him, “Who are you?” because they knew it was the Lord.
undefined Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and did the same with the fish.
undefined This was now the third time Jesus was revealed to the disci-ples after he was raised from the dead.Peter’s Restoration

undefined Then when they had finished break-fast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these do?” He replied, “Yes, Lord, you know I love you.” Jesus told him, “Feed my lambs.”
undefined Jesus said a second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?” He replied, “Yes, Lord, you know I love you.” Jesus told him, “Shepherd my sheep.”

undefined Jesus said a third time, “Si-mon, son of John, do you love me?” Peter was distressed that Jesus asked him a third time, “Do you love me?” and said, “Lord, you know everything. You know that I love you.” Jesus replied, “Feed my sheep.

undefined I tell you the solemn truth, when you were young, you tied your clothes around you and went wherever you wanted, but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and others will tie you up and bring you where you do not want to go.”
undefined (Now Jesus said this to indicate clearly by what kind of death Peter was going to glorify God.) After he said this, Jesus told Peter, “Follow me.”Peter and the Disciple Jesus Loved

undefined Peter turned around and saw the dis-ciple whom Jesus loved following them. (This was the disciple who had leaned back against Jesus’ chest at the meal and asked, “Lord, who is the one who is going to betray you?”)
undefined So when Peter saw him, he asked Jesus, “Lord, what about him?”
undefined Jesus replied, “If I want him to live until I come back, what concern is that of yours? You follow me!”

undefined So the saying circulated among the brothers and sisters that this disciple was not going to die. But Jesus did not say to him that he was not going to die, but rather, “If I want him to live until I come back, what concern is that of yours?”A Final Note
undefined This is the disciple who testifies about these things and has written these things, and we know that his testimony is true.
undefined There are many other things that Jesus did. If every one of them were written down, I suppose the whole world would not have room for the books that would be written.
